lead](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/steve-williams-wins-chaotic-tour-of-britain-third-stage-to-extend-race-lead/view/)Rider claims second consecutive stage win in BarnsleyAlaphilippe and Sutton threaten in rainy conditionsSteve Williams tightened his grip on the Tour of Britain on the uphill finish in Barnsley, extending his lead with a 10sec time bonus by winning stage three. It was a second stage win in two days for Williams at the end of a pulsating four hours of racing across Yorkshire. It was far from plain sailing, however, with first Julian Alaphilippe and then Louis Sutton giving the Welshman and his Is - [Ingebrigtsen and Kerr left trailing by Nuguse’s sprint in Olympic rematch](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/ingebrigtsen-and-kerr-left-trailing-by-nuguses-sprint-in-olympic-rematch/view/)Bronze medallist springs a surprise to win Zurich 1500mDina Asher-Smith pipped by world champion in 100mOver the past 18 months, we have become used to seeing Josh Kerr slugging it out for gold and glory in the world’s biggest 1500m races. But when the Scot squeezed hard on the trigger over the final 200m at Zurich’s Weltklasse on Thursday night he found nothing left in the barrel.Kerr wasn’t the only one struggling to keep up with the searing pace. The Olympic champion Co - [San Marino, the world’s lowest-ranked nation, ends 20-year, 140-match winless streak](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/san-marino-the-worlds-lowest-ranked-nation-ends-20-year-140-match-winless-streak/view/)Two decades, 140 games, zero wins. - [Scotland 2-3 Poland: Nations League – as it happened](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/scotland-2-3-poland-nations-league-as-it-happened/view/)Scotland came from 2-0 down at half-time to level but lost to a stoppage-time penalty at Hampden6 min: McLean snaps into a couple of tackles in the middle of the park. Twice he strips the Poles of possession; twice his team-mates fail to react by snaffling the loose ball. He gesticulates in mild irritation, but that’s good tenacious play by McLean. Onwards and upwards.4 min: That was a crisp little move down the left, and Scotland continue to start in a confident manner, giving Poland no t - [Olympic coach sacked by Swimming Australia after ‘Go Korea’ comments in Paris](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/olympic-coach-sacked-by-swimming-australia-after-go-korea-comments-in-paris/view/)Six weeks after saying he hoped a South Korean swimmer would beat Australian athletes in Paris, Michael Palfrey has had his contract ripped up. - [Poland seal Nations League win with late penalty to spoil Scotland comeback](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/poland-seal-nations-league-win-with-late-penalty-to-spoil-scotland-comeback/view/)The bad news keeps on coming for Steve Clarke and Scotland. Just when it looked as if damage incurred during a horrible Euro 2024 – and in the first half here – looked like being repaired, Poland snatched a 97th-minute victory. Grant Hanley’s lunge triggered a penalty which only added to despondency around the Scotland team.Until that point, even the extending of a run to one win in 13 felt unimportant. Clarke’s team had recovered from two goals behind at half-time to lev - [‘Fall from grace’: ‘Same old issues’ burn Broncos as Storm massacre Walters’ struggling outfit](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/fall-from-grace-same-old-issues-burn-broncos-as-storm-massacre-walters-struggling-outfit/view/)“The same old problems” once again shone through in the Broncos’ 50-12 loss to the Storm, with league legends labelling Kevin Walters’ outfit “disjointed” amid a “fall from grace”. - [Australian long-jumper Vanessa Low shatters world record in Paris Paralympics triumph](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/australian-long-jumper-vanessa-low-shatters-world-record-in-paris-paralympics-triumph/view/)Australian long-jumper Vanessa Low has completed a Paralympic threepeat, winning gold at Stade de France on Friday morning AEST. - [CATastrophe for Power as Geelong send warning to AFL rivals with finals humiliation](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/catastrophe-for-power-as-geelong-send-warning-to-afl-rivals-with-finals-humiliation/view/)Geelong has booked a home preliminary final in two weeks’ time after improbably pulverising Port Adelaide on Thursday night at Adelaide Oval, triumphing 20.18 (138) to 7.12 (54). - [Here are the medal standings after day eight of the Paralympic Games](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/here-are-the-medal-standings-after-day-eight-of-the-paralympic-games/view/)Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes won overnight — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard. - [The push to move AFL Grand Final from Melbourne to Sydney as premier says 'let's take it off them'](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/the-push-to-move-afl-grand-final-from-melbourne-to-sydney-as-premier-says-lets-take-it-off-them/view/)Melbourne has tightly held the rights to hosting the AFL Grand Final for almost every year since the code began. NSW Premier Chris Minns says "let's take it off them". - [The NFL may be about to see something ‘no one has ever done’ before... here’s proof](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/the-nfl-may-be-about-to-see-something-no-one-has-ever-done-before-heres-proof/view/)Only a few hours after the red and yellow confetti had fallen and the Vince Lombardi trophy had been lifted, attention already turned to what could come next. - [Slipper to equal Gregan record, Jorgensen earns first start](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/slipper-to-equal-gregan-record-jorgensen-earns-first-start/view/)James Slipper will draw level with Wallabies legend George Gregan, who played his 139th and final Test in 2007. - [‘So far off the mark’: Hinkley’s stinging admission as ANOTHER Power finals free fall threatens](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/so-far-off-the-mark-hinkleys-stinging-admission-as-another-power-finals-free-fall-threatens/view/)Under siege Port Adelaide coach Ken Hinkley admits him and his side must “live in the present” temporarily in an effort to accept the truths of their 84-smashing at the hands of Geelong on Thursday night. - [Power outage! ELEVEN fails in finals flop as axe hovers over struggling stars — Player Ratings](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/power-outage-eleven-fails-in-finals-flop-as-axe-hovers-over-struggling-stars-player-ratings/view/)It was a dire night for the Port Adelaide Football Club, losing to Geelong by 84 points on their own turf. - [‘Just dismembered them’: Power’s ‘brutal’ finals reality check as damning vision emerges](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/just-dismembered-them-powers-brutal-finals-reality-check-as-damning-vision-emerges/view/)Severe doubt hangs over Port Adelaide’s season after it was categorically “dismembered” by Geelong in Thursday night’s qualifying final. - [‘Killed me’: How brutal $5k Eels call left Tigers sensation ‘gutted’... and unearthed next NRL superstar](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/killed-me-how-brutal-5k-eels-call-left-tigers-sensation-gutted-and-unearthed-next-nrl-superstar/view/)Lachie Galvin, with a grin, will tell you he’s the most boring kid anywhere in the NRL. - [The odd and ancient history of the wooden spoon](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/the-odd-and-ancient-history-of-the-wooden-spoon/view/)When Wests Tigers and Parramatta Eels meet at Campbelltown on Friday night, they each face the ignominy of the NRL's wooden spoon with defeat. But where did that term come from, and what does it have to do with Cambridge University's Maths department? - [NRL 2024: Inside Wests Tigers rookie Lachlan Galvin’s rapid rise, Parramatta Eels background, contract, Spoon Bowl](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/nrl-2024-inside-wests-tigers-rookie-lachlan-galvins-rapid-rise-parramatta-eels-background-contract-spoon-bowl/view/)Lachie Galvin, with a grin, will tell you he’s the most boring kid anywhere in the NRL. - [NFL 2024: How Kansas City Chiefs could make history with third-straight Super Bowl win, Chiefs vs Ravens season opener, Patrick Mahomes, Xavier Worthy speed](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/nfl-2024-how-kansas-city-chiefs-could-make-history-with-third-straight-super-bowl-win-chiefs-vs-ravens-season-opener-patrick-mahomes-xavier-worthy-speed/view/)Only a few hours after the red and yellow confetti had fallen and the Vince Lombardi trophy had been lifted, attention already turned to what could come next. - [Belmore is alive with Bulldogs fans again. Why are the police fining them?](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/belmore-is-alive-with-bulldogs-fans-again-why-are-the-police-fining-them/view/) [via](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/belmore-is-alive-with-bulldogs-fans-again-why-are-the-police-fining-them/) [theage.com.au](https://www.theage.com.au/sport/nrl/belmore-is-alive-with-bulldogs-fans-again-why-are-the-police-fining-them-20240905-p5k80b.html?ref=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_source=rss_sport)You know the Bulldogs are officially back when Burwood Road is jammed with delirious supporters. But the fan activity has attracted a heavy police presence. - [Pucovski taking legal advice on concussion retirement](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/pucovski-taking-legal-advice-on-concussion-retirement/view/)The batting prodigy was advised to retire because of concussion concerns but not forced to call an end to his career. The saga might push cricket to adopt a system for compensation payouts akin to that used in the AFL. - [‘Do these guys hate each other?’: Hawks skipper on the golden era, the handover and the revival](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/do-these-guys-hate-each-other-hawks-skipper-on-the-golden-era-the-handover-and-the-revival/view/)James Sicily opens up on his volatile former self, the “confusing” Clarkson-Mitchell handover, and the Hawthorn “mosquitos”. - [From a shark attack to Paralympic silver: Truwit’s remarkable journey](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/from-a-shark-attack-to-paralympic-silver-truwits-remarkable-journey/view/)American wins medal just 16 months after losing a legBecky Redfern and Alice Tai wins golds for Great BritainEven in the story-laden world of the Paralympics, where things are never monochrome, it is hard to trump getting your leg bitten off by a shark one year, and swimming for medals in Paris the next.Yet that is the true tale behind the success of Ali Truwit, 24-year-old ex-Yale competitive swimmer, and silver medallist in the La Défense Arena in the S10 400m freestyle on Thursday nigh - [‘We’ll make it happen’: The meeting with Rusty that united all four Burgess brothers at Souths](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/well-make-it-happen-the-meeting-with-rusty-that-united-all-four-burgess-brothers-at-souths/view/)The curtain comes down on the 15-year Burgess era at South Sydney tonight, as the last remaining brother, Tom, plays his final game for the club. - [‘Not good enough’: Socceroos searching for answers after Gold Coast nightmare](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/not-good-enough-socceroos-searching-for-answers-after-gold-coast-nightmare/view/)It was supposed to be a relatively simple outing to start the third round of World Cup qualification, but it ended up as a night of historical lows for Graham Arnold’s men. -
